com.direwolfdigital.cake.data.archetypes:
This card can only be attached to {D} Pokémon. This card provides {D} Energy only while this card is attached to a {D} Pokémon.

Whenever the {D} Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an attack from your opponent's Pokémon-EX (even if that Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon-EX.

(If this card is attached to anything other than a {D} Pokémon, discard this card.)
Dangerous Energy

This card can only be attached to {L} Pokémon. This card provides {L} Energy only while this card is attached to a {L} Pokémon.

The {L} Pokémon this card is attached to has no Weakness.

(If this card is attached to anything other than a {L} Pokémon, discard this card.)
Flash Energy
You can play this card only if you have more Prize cards left than your opponent. \n\nEach player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck. Then, draw 6 cards. Your opponent draws 3 cards.
Ace Trainer
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Ampharos-EX.
Ampharos Spirit Link
Shuffle 3 Pokémon Tool cards from your discard pile into your deck.
Eco Arm
Shuffle 5 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.
Energy Recycler
Put 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
Energy Retrieval
At any time between turns, put 2 damage counters on each Mega Evolution Pokémon.
Faded Town
Each player's {G} Pokémon can evolve during his or her first turn or the turn he or she plays those Pokémon.
Forest of Giant Plants
Until the end of your opponent's next turn, each Pokémon in play, in each player's hand, and in each player's discard pile has no Abilities. (This includes cards that come into play on that turn.)
Hex Maniac
Search your deck for a Pokémon with 90 HP or less, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Level Ball
Whenever the Pokémon this card is attached to is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if that Pokémon is Knocked Out), draw 2 cards.
Lucky Helmet
Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon.
Lysandre
Discard any Stadium card in play. Then, draw a card.
Paint Roller
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Sceptile-EX.
Sceptile Spirit Link
Search your deck for a Supporter card and a basic Energy card, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Steven
Look at the top 4 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Trainer card you find there (except for Trainers' Mail) and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
Trainers' Mail
Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Tyranitar-EX.
Tyranitar Spirit Link
com.direwolfdigital.cake.data.decks.pcds: Fury of Waves, Song of Steel! \nCrush your opponents with iron or sink them in the depths—either way you wield the chilling might of the Iron Tide theme deck! With Metagross leading the way, this deck shines like steel from the start. Add in some big attacks like Forbidden Iron Hammer from Registeel and Hydro Splash from Vaporeon, and your opponent is awash in trouble, bubbles, and a steely doom! Then evolve Magikarp to Gyarados to truly thrash opposing Pokémon, and watch the tide of the battle turn in your favor!

Strength of Spirit, Strength of Stone! \nThis deck's got heart—the kind of prizefighter's heart that never quits! With the Stone Heart theme deck, your Pokémon can poison, paralyze, and trick opposing Pokémon in many ways—and the mighty Regirock leads the way, with its Unyielding Rock attack perfect for taking down Pokémon-EX! Add in the Legendary Pokémon Virizion with the power to hit harder if you're behind, and the Stone Heart deck is full of fighting spirit. This is one contender that's never down for the count!
com.direwolfdigital.cake.data.products.b: Fury of Waves, Song of Steel! \nCrush your opponents with iron or sink them in the depths—either way you wield the chilling might of the Iron Tide theme deck! With Metagross leading the way, this deck shines like steel from the start. Add in some big attacks like Forbidden Iron Hammer from Registeel and Hydro Splash from Vaporeon, and your opponent is awash in trouble, bubbles, and a steely doom! Then evolve Magikarp to Gyarados to truly thrash opposing Pokémon, and watch the tide of the battle turn in your favor!

Strength of Spirit, Strength of Stone! \nThis deck's got heart—the kind of prizefighter's heart that never quits! With the Stone Heart theme deck, your Pokémon can poison, paralyze, and trick opposing Pokémon in many ways—and the mighty Regirock leads the way, with its Unyielding Rock attack perfect for taking down Pokémon-EX! Add in the Legendary Pokémon Virizion with the power to hit harder if you're behind, and the Stone Heart deck is full of fighting spirit. This is one contender that's never down for the count!
com.direwolfdigital.cake.rules.abilities: Search your deck for up to 3 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
This Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.
Heal 100 damage from each of your Benched Pokémon. Then, discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon.
If this Pokémon has any {D} Energy attached to it, this attack does 20 more damage.
This attack does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to both Active Pokémon.
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.
Flip a coin for each {W} Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.
Put 2 Pokémon from your discard pile into your hand.
Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
This attack does 10 more damage for each Pokémon in your discard pile.
This attack does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Choose a Supporter card from your opponent's discard pile and use it as the effect of this attack.
This attack does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.
Discard the top 4 cards of your deck. If any of those cards are {R} Energy cards, attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like.
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.
Your opponent can't play any Pokémon Tool, Special Energy, or Stadium cards from his or her hand during his or her next turn.
This attack does 20 more damage for each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.
If this Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 80 more damage. Then, remove all Special Conditions from this Pokémon.
Discard all Special Energy attached to each of your opponent's Pokémon.
Look through your deck. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.
If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 70 more damage. Then, discard that Stadium card.
Search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
This attack does 60 more damage for each damage counter on your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Devolve as many of your Benched Pokémon as many times as you like. Put each Evolution card removed this way into your hand.
Discard the top card of your deck. If that card is a {F} Energy card, attach it to this Pokémon.
Flip 2 coins. This attack does 90 damage times the number of heads.
Flip 3 coins. For each heads, choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into his or her deck.
This attack does 30 damage times the number of your Benched Pokémon.
Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with his or her Active Pokémon. The new Active Pokémon is now Confused.
Flip 2 coins. If either of them is tails, this attack does nothing.
Would you like to do 50 more damage and leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Paralyzed? If you do, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.
You may do 50 more damage and leave your opponent's Active Pokémon Paralyzed. If you do, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 30 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.
Move as many {G} Energy attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.
If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, discard an Energy attached to that Pokémon.
This attack does 30 more damage for each damage counter on each of your Benched Magikarp.
Put 3 damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
You can rearrange the top 3 cards of either player's deck. Choose a deck to look at.
Look at the top 3 cards of either player's deck and put them back on top of that player's deck in any order.
If there is any Stadium card in play, this attack does 100 more damage. Discard that Stadium card.
This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.
Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.
Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
Discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 100 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. The Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.
The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.
If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.
You may draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.
Would you like to discard all {M} Energy attached to this Pokémon to do 80 more damage?
You may discard all {M} Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, this attack does 80 more damage.
Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
You may attach up to 2 {G} Energy cards from your hand to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. If you attached Energy to a Pokémon in this way, heal all damage from that Pokémon.
This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.
This attack does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon for each {C} in its Retreat Cost. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.
This attack does 10 more damage for each card in your hand.
If you have more Prize cards left than your opponent, this attack does 80 more damage.
During your opponent's next turn, prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by Pokémon-EX.
Devolve each of your opponent's evolved Pokémon and put the highest Stage Evolution card on it into your opponent's hand.
During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon can't be affected by any Special Conditions.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep and Poisoned.
During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks cost {C} more.
Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.
Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, search your deck for up to 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to that Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.
This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.
This attack does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon. This Pokémon is now Confused.
Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.
Would you like to do 40 more damage? If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.
You may do 40 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.
This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.
This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance.
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage. If tails, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.
Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.
Look at the top 4 cards of your deck and attach as many {L} Energy cards you find there as you like to this Pokémon. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
Move 2 Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon-EX. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)
Put a card from your discard pile into your hand.
Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.
Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.
If your opponent's Active Pokémon is affected by a Special Condition, this attack does 70 more damage.
If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 60 more damage.
Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
Your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.
Move all damage counters from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon.
If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, whenever your opponent flips a coin during his or her turn, treat it as tails.
Would you like to search for a Pokémon that evolves from Eevee?
Each of your Stage 1 Pokémon in play is now a {W} Pokémon in addition to its existing types.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon.
As long as this Pokémon is in play, it is {P} and {F} type.
Each of your Stage 1 Pokémon in play is now a {L} Pokémon in addition to its existing types.
Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may discard this Pokémon and all cards attached to it (this does not count as a Knock Out). If you do, draw a card.
Each of your Stage 1 Pokémon in play is now a {R} Pokémon in addition to its existing types.
Each player can't play any Item cards from his or her hand.

Once during your turn (before your attack), you may switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. If you do, your opponent switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.
Once during your turn (before your attack), you may use this Ability. Both Active Pokémon (except for {G} Pokémon) are now Poisoned.
Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by your opponent's Mega Evolution Pokémon.
Would you like to search your deck for up to 3 Pokémon-EX?

When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench, you may search your deck for up to 3 Pokémon-EX (except for Hoopa-EX), reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.
Would you like to search your deck for a Goomy to put onto your Bench?
Whenever you attach a {W} Energy card from your hand to this Pokémon, you may search your deck for Goomy and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.
You may choose a Goomy to put onto your Bench.
This Pokémon may have up to 2 Pokémon Tool cards attached to it.
When 1 of your Pokémon becomes this Pokémon, heal all damage from it.
Prevent all effects of your opponent's Pokémon's Abilities done to this Pokémon.
playmat.prompt.reordertopcardsfromdeckre: Select cards to return to the top of your deck.
playmat.prompt.selectagrassenergy: You may attach up to 2 {G} Energy cards to Benched Pokémon to heal all damage from them.
product.coin.kyogredarksilverpblack.name: Dark Silver Primal Kyogre Coin
product.xy7.booster.description: Power of the Ancient Days!\nReady for some new tricks? Hoopa-EX brings new Mythical power to the Pokémon world, along with fierce new challengers like Mega Tyranitar-EX, Mega Ampharos-EX, and Mega Sceptile-EX! The Pokémon TCG: XY—Ancient Origins expansion transforms ancient secrets into modern battling techniques, with all-new Special Energy cards, new Ancient Traits, and Shiny versions of Primal Kyogre-EX, Primal Groudon-EX, and Mega Rayquaza-EX! The power of the ancients is unbound!
specialvisualizations.damagetakenbetween: This Pokémon will take damage between turns.
specialvisualizations.drawwhendamaged: When this Pokémon is damaged, its owner will draw cards.
specialvisualizations.immunetoopponentab: This Pokémon is immune to all effects of the opponent's Pokémon's Abilities.
